Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Excluding Certain Government Ships from the Application of the Canada Shipping Act

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport, pursuant to subsection 6(2)a of the Canada Shipping Act, hereby makes the annexed Regulations Excluding Certain Government Ships from the Application of the Canada Shipping Act.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Canadian Coast Guard ship means a ship that is entrusted for management or operation to the Department of Fisheries and Oceans. (navire de la Garde côtière canadienne)

Heading.TitleText: Exclusion from the Application of the Act

Section.Text: The following provisions of the Canada Shipping Act do not apply to Canadian Coast Guard ships:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 110 (regulations respecting certification of masters and seamen);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section 232 (regulations giving effect to international labour conventions);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sections 389 and 390 (regulations respecting dangerous goods), in so far as they relate to the carriage of aviation fuel.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on February 25, 2000.
